name: European Federation for Managers in Technologies of Information and Communication
goal:
eTIC is a Federation representing the European Managers working in the field of technologies of information and communication.

eTIC was founded in Brussels in 1999 with the name "Medi@Managers". Its 7 founding organisations were issued from: Belgium, Finland, France, Germany, Italy, Norway and Sweden. In September 2006, the General Assembly chose a new name for the federation: eTIC.
interests: Business and Industry, Communication, Competition, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Employment and Social Affairs, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives:
-Consultation document on the EU 2020 Strategy
-Data protection for employees
-Green paper on pension policy
-Revision of the European working time directive

-Consultation on the new EU occupational safety and health policy framework
-Green Paper - Preparing for a Fully Converged Audiovisual World: Growth, Creation and Values
-Plan for single telecoms market
-Ethics of Security and Surveillance Technologies
